{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3526841,"name":"Lavi Arzi","username":"LaviRZ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lavirz/{size}/176648_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T06:12:48.225Z","cooked":"

In the past 2 hours, our two radios stopped working.
Both were configured as robot client, with 2.4GHz.
One just stopped interacting virtually, meaning the correct lights were on (1,3,5 solid, 2 blinking), but it didn’t respond on 192.168.69.1 (connection refused)
The other one, stopped showing the SSID (same lights as the previous case), and when connecting to the DS port, it didn’t show the robot. (In this case, when trying to connect with Ethernet to the rio, it didn’t go well either, only USB B worked.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T06:13:56.247Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":344,"readers_count":343,"score":153.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491653,"topic_slug":"2xvh-109-stopped-working","display_username":"Lavi Arzi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer/493002/3","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"New radio not appearing on computer?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 Controls/Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2xvh-109-stopped-working/491653/1","custom_user_title":"5990 Controls/Strategy Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3526959,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T13:18:40.283Z","cooked":"

If you connected to the first router via the DS port, would you establish a connection? (Just a normal connection between the PC and the router.)

On the second one, are you able to ping the default gateway?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T13:18:40.283Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":311,"readers_count":310,"score":67.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491653,"topic_slug":"2xvh-109-stopped-working","display_username":"Mohammed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61815,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/2xvh-109-stopped-working/491653/2","custom_user_title":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3526962,"name":"Lavi Arzi","username":"LaviRZ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lavirz/{size}/176648_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T13:23:26.351Z","cooked":"

First one - the web dashboard of the radio wouldn’t load (192.168.69.1)

Second one - did load from the DS port, the DS got a sensible 10.TE.EM.x IP, but the radio wasn’t passing through, and the 2.4GHz access point didn’t show on any wifi enabled devices nearby.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T13:23:26.351Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":296,"readers_count":295,"score":64.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491653,"topic_slug":"2xvh-109-stopped-working","display_username":"Lavi Arzi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":61815,"username":"Mohammed","name":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 Controls/Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2xvh-109-stopped-working/491653/3","custom_user_title":"5990 Controls/Strategy Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3526965,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T13:31:30.722Z","cooked":"

For the first one try using Angry IP Scanner and scan for active IPs (alternatively you could probably use the ipconfig command from the cmd to check the gateway ip), maybe the gateway IP changed or something

For the second one do a sanity check and make sure if the #3 DIP switch is ON, also try using the Network Assistant Tool (If you were able to make direct connection with the radio somehow), other than that I’m not really sure how to help you other than telling you to contact Vivid-Hosting for support because what you’re experiencing is odd.

The DIP switch was on for sure, and the third light was on. In both cases.
Made this post in hopes of a response from @kiettyyyy or someone else that could have more info than the docs

I’m 100% with Thad. But I also wonder if there’s any analysis being done on the devices needing recovery to determine why it needs recovery - with the hope being to eliminate a root case.

I’m also curious how many spares will be traveling with fields, and if/how we may be able to remotely get support/recover them at events if needed.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-02-17T01:01:41.785Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491653,"topic_slug":"2xvh-109-stopped-working","display_username":"Brian Rozmierski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Volunteer / Former 5881 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2xvh-109-stopped-working/491653/17","custom_user_title":"FRC Volunteer / Former 5881 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529247,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-17T01:12:30.712Z","cooked":"
bdaroz:

But I also wonder if there’s any analysis being done on the devices needing recovery to determine why it needs recovery - with the hope being to eliminate a root case.

Considering that firmware version 1.2.5, 1.2.8, and 1.2.9 changelogs mention changes for memory corruption/stuck in bootloader issues seen by teams, I think it’s pretty safe to say that Vivid Hosting is working through root cause and fixing issues and not just fixing the symptom.

What we don’t see is status on teams uptake of these new versions.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-02-17T01:13:28.787Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491653,"topic_slug":"2xvh-109-stopped-working","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2xvh-109-stopped-working/491653/18","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529252,"name":"Alex","username":"ajs2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-17T01:17:26.912Z","cooked":"
Joe_Ross:

What we don’t see is status on teams uptake of these new versions.

If a team somehow doesn’t notice the updates, their radio will get updated at competition - I believe the kiosk will automatically update radios that are out of date.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-02-17T01:17:34.719Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491653,"topic_slug":"2xvh-109-stopped-working","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6238 alum (he/they)"},"post_url":"/t/2xvh-109-stopped-working/491653/19","custom_user_title":"6238 alum (he/they)","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529822,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-17T07:12:55.999Z","cooked":"
Joe_Ross:

Considering that firmware version 1.2.5, 1.2.8, and 1.2.9 changelogs mention changes for memory corruption/stuck in bootloader issues seen by teams, I think it’s pretty safe to say that Vivid Hosting is working through root cause and fixing issues and not just fixing the symptom.

What we don’t see is status on teams uptake of these new versions.

As we’re seeing more radios get used by teams, we’re seeing different failure modes that just wasn’t encountered during previous events. In all of these cases, we’ve completed RCA against the failure and issued fixes.

We’ve gotten a number of radios back from RMA shipments where teams were using firmware installed by the factory. We’re hoping that one competition starts, teams will be forced to update via the kiosk.
